AK.textOfLegislation: The Alaska State Supreme Court placed a moratorium on all non-emergency cases including most civil cases on March 13.

AL.textOfLegislation: Alabama has suspended in-person civil cases throughout the state, which should apply to evictions and foreclosures, although it does allow remote proceedings.

AR.textOfLegislation: Arkansas has suspended all in-person court hearings, but there is no moratorium on eviction proceedings and judges can hold hearings remotely.

AZ.textOfLegislation: Governor Ducey today issued an executive order delaying the enforcement of eviction action orders for renters impacted by COVID-19.

CA.textOfLegislation: Most evictions in California are suspended until 90-days after the Governor lifts the state of emergency related to the COVID‐19 pandemic under the Judicial Council's Emergency Rule 1, issued April 6, 2020.

CO.textOfLegislation: Colorado Governor issued an executive order that directs certain departments to work with landlords and banks to find lawful means of avoiding evictions, as well as asks sheriffs and other local enforcement to avoid executing evictions.

CT.textOfLegislation: Landlords in Connecticut can't give tenants a notice to quit or start an eviction in most situations until July 1, 2020 under Executive Order 7X, issued by Governor Ned Lamont on April 10, 2020.

DC.textOfLegislation: The District of Columbia Superior Court Order 03-1520 has temporarily suspend all evictions until May 1, 2020.

DE.textOfLegislation: Governor John Carney issued a moratorium for evictions through the State of Emergency Declaration Sixth Modification on March 24, 2020.

FL.textOfLegislation: Tenants in Florida are protected from eviction for non-payment by Executive Order 20-94, issued by Governor Ron DeSantis until May 17, 2020.

GA.textOfLegislation: Tenants in Georgia are not protected from eviction for non-payment. Georgia has not implemented statewide orders to protect tenants from evictions for non-payment during or immediately following the COVID-19 pandemic.

HI.textOfLegislation: Governor David Ige proclaimed a State of Emergency which automatically activates the provisions of section 127A-30(2) of the Hawaii Revised Statutes, which states, that “no Landlord shall terminate any tenancy for a residential dwelling unit in the area that is the subject of the proclamation".

ID.textOfLegislation: Idaho issued a statewide order directing that eviction cases be suspended except for drug-related cases until April 15. It is not clear if eviction cases have now resumed.

IL.textOfLegislation: Tenants in Illinois impacted by the COVID-19 crisis are protected from eviction for nonpayment per Governor Pritzker's COVID-19 Executive Order No. 28, Issued April 23, 2020.

IN.textOfLegislation: Tenants in Indiana are protected from eviction until the state of emergency is over per Governor Holcomb's Executive Order 20-06 issued March 19, 2020.

KS.textOfLegislation: Kansas Governor Laura Kelly has declared that eviction proceedings cannot be brought as a result of nonpayment due to financial hardship related to COVID-19 per Executive Order 20-10.

KY.textOfLegislation: Governor Beshear’s Executive Order protects tenants from eviction during the COVID-19 crisis. And, on April 1, the Kentucky Supreme Court prohibited clerks from accepting eviction filings until May 31.

LA.textOfLegislation: Governor John Bel Edwards has issued Proclamation 41-JBE-2020 which suspends deadlines in all legal proceedings, including evictions, until at least April 30, 2020. The Supreme Court of Louisiana has ordered courts to limit activity to only essential proceedings, which do not include evictions.

MA.textOfLegislation: Tenants in Massachusetts are protected from eviction for non-payment of rent by Chapter 65 of the Acts of 2020 issued by Governor Charlie Baker on April 20, 2020.

MD.textOfLegislation: Maryland has temporarily banned evictions for non-payment of rent for tenants who have lost income because of the pandemic.

ME.textOfLegislation: Maine's Judicial Branch ordered that effective on March 18, 2020 through May 1, 2020, all evictions and foreclosures are suspended.

MI.textOfLegislation: Tenants in Michigan are protected from eviction for non-payment of rent by Executive Orders 2020-54 and 2020-53 issued by Governor Gretchen Whitmer on April 17, 2020.

MN.textOfLegislation: Tenants in Minnesota are protected from eviction for non-payment of rent by Executive Order 20-14 issued by Governor Tim Walz on March 23, 2020.

MO.textOfLegislation: The Supreme Court of Missouri has suspended in-person proceedings effective April 1, 2020.

MS.textOfLegislation: The State Supreme Court has directed local courts to determine their own court operations, although it has urged them to limit in-person proceedings. Most courts are still operating, and none clearly limit evictions.

NE.textOfLegislation: Tenants in Nebraska are protected from eviction until May 31, 2020 from non-payment of rent due on or after March 13, 2020 by Executive Order 20-07 issued by Governor Pete Ricketts. Tenants must be able to show the landlord evidence of lost income related to COVID-19 to delay eviction.

NJ.textOfLegislation: Tenants in New Jersey are protected from eviction for non-payment by Executive Order No. 106, issued by Governor Philip Murphy on March 19, 2020.

NY.textOfLegislation: Tenants in New York State are protected from eviction until June 20, 2020 by Executive Order 202.8, issued by Governor Andrew Cuomo on March 20, 2020.

OK.textOfLegislation: All deadlines and procedures in civil matters, including eviction matters, are suspended through May 15, 2020. District and Special Judges have been ordered to reschedule hearings scheduled for before May 15, 2020.

PA.textOfLegislation: Pennsylvania Supreme Court ordered a stay on all evictions until April 30, 2020.

PR.textOfLegislation: Congress passed the CARES Act on March 27, 2020 (Public Law 116-136). Tenants in covered properties are protected from eviction for non-payment or any other reason until August 23, 2020.

TX.textOfLegislation: The Texas Supreme Court has suspended all eviction proceedings and hearings until May 18, 2020.

UT.textOfLegislation: Tenants in Utah who were current on rent payments March 31, 2020 and have suffered loss of income or job due to COVID-19 are protected from eviction for non-payment of rent until May 15, 2020 by Executive Order issued by Governor Charlie Baker on April 2, 2020.

VA.textOfLegislation: The Virginia Supreme Court has temporarily suspended all non-emergency hearings in all circuit and district courts throughout the state until May 18, 2020.

VT.textOfLegislation: The Vermont Supreme Court has suspended all non-emergency Superior Court hearings. However, judges will have the discretion to hold emergency hearings on landlord-tenant issues on a case-by-case basis.

WA.textOfLegislation: Tenants in Washington are temporarily protected from eviction until April 17, 2020 by Proclamation Amending Proclamation 20-05 issued by Governor Jay Inslee on March 18, 2020.

WI.textOfLegislation: The Wisconsin Supreme Court has suspended in-person proceedings, with some exceptions, throughout the state until further order. Remote virtual hearings are recommended.

WV.textOfLegislation: The Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia has suspended in-person proceedings, with some limited emergency exceptions, throughout the state until May 1, 2020.

WY.textOfLegislation: The Wyoming Supreme Court has suspended in-person proceedings, with some exceptions, throughout the state until May 31, 2020. While this may apply to eviction cases, remote virtual hearings are permitted.
